definition: to beat/to hit/variant of 考[kao3]/to inspect/to test/to take an exam
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams

sentences.english: Jubilantly they field into the classroom. The professor passedoutthe papers.
sentences.chinese: 他们欢快地进了考场，教授把考卷发给他们。

sentences.english: And the test arrangement is the important constituent part of the educational administration management.
sentences.chinese: 而考场安排管理系统是教务管理系统的重要组成部分。

sentences.english: Candidates can attend the test with he admission ticket issued by the testing site.
sentences.chinese: 考生持主考单位核发的“准考证”进入考场参加考试。

sentences.english: Before going into the room, take three DEEP breaths!
sentences.chinese: 进考场前的深呼吸可以帮你舒缓压力及紧张情绪。

sentences.english: This exam will last 2 hours, no one is allowed to leave until the bell rings.
sentences.chinese: 考试时间为两个小时，打铃之前不许出考场。

sentences.english: Einsun jumps to the first place in credit in the comprehensive test for the amount of annual examination in Southwest China.
sentences.chinese: 爱因森国际综合考场年考量考试信誉度跃居西南第一。

sentences.english: The Monday venue is the Foreign Affairs Hotel of Shenyang Normal University.
sentences.chinese: 周一的口试考场为沈阳师范大学外事宾馆。

sentences.english: So the Ministry of Examinations and the National Examination Center are right next to the University?
sentences.chinese: 原来考试院和国家考场就在学校附近。

sentences.english: Nearly all the students entered the examination room with a piece of answer.
sentences.chinese: 考试的时候几乎个个考生都是带着一份答案进考场的。

sentences.english: He was the invigilator of No. 2 Testroom.
sentences.chinese: 他是第二考场的监考员。

sentences.english: While entering test field, I get up for the fluster, brain one blank.
sentences.chinese: 一进考场，我就慌乱起来，脑子里一片空白。

sentences.english: When the students left the examination room, they jotted down these questions quickly from memory.
sentences.chinese: 离开考场后，学生立即凭记忆将这些问题记下来。

sentences.english: Here's another one who takes a lucky rabbit's foot into an exam?
sentences.chinese: 这里有另一个，谁把幸运兔的脚带到了考场上？

sentences.english: It was already 7pm when I walked out of the exam hall.
sentences.chinese: 从考场走出来的时候已经是晚上七十了。

sentences.english: Once in the examination hall, he forgot about all this.
sentences.chinese: 他一进考场，这一切他都忘了。

sentences.english: The exam was held in Zhongshan Vocational-technical School.
sentences.chinese: 考场设在中山职业技术学院。

definition: exam candidate/student whose name has been put forward for an exam
to hand in one's examination script
an examiner/an official conducting an exam
the exam area/the district where an exam takes place
variant of 復習|复习[fu4 xi2]
